<select name="resource_category_ids[]" class="textCtrl" multiple="multiple" size="8"> <option value="0" {xen:selected 'in_array(0, {$selCategoryIds})'}>({xen:phrase none})</option> <xen:foreach loop="$categories" value="$category"> <option value="{$category.resource_category_id}" {xen:selected 'in_array({$category.resource_category_id}, {$selCategoryIds})'}>{xen:string repeat, '  ', $category.depth}{$category.category_title}</option> </xen:foreach> </select>
<xen:include template="thread_prefix_helper_user_groups" />

<xen:title>{xen:phrase import_field}</xen:title>
<xen:form action="{xen:adminlink resource-custom-fields/import}" upload="true">
<xen:uploadunit label="{xen:if '{$xenOptions.currentVersionId} >= 1030010', {xen:phrase import_from_uploaded_xml_file}, {xen:phrase import_from_uploaded_file}}:" name="upload" />
<xen:radiounit label="{xen:phrase import_as}:" name="target">
<xen:option label="{xen:phrase field_in_group}:" value="new" selected="true"> <xen:select name="field_group_id"> <xen:option value="0" label="({xen:phrase none})" /> <xen:options source="$fieldGroupOptions" /> </xen:select> <xen:textbox placeholder="{xen:phrase field_id}" name="overwrite_field_id" /> </xen:option>
<xen:option label="{xen:phrase overwrite_field}:" value="overwrite"> <xen:select name="overwrite_field_id"> <xen:foreach loop="$fields" value="$field"> <xen:option value="{$field.field_id}">{$field.title}</xen:option> </xen:foreach> </xen:select> </xen:option>
</xen:radiounit>
<xen:submitunit save="{xen:phrase import}" />
<input type="hidden" name="_xfConfirm" value="1" /> </xen:form>

<xen:submitunit save="{xen:phrase proceed}..." />

</xen:form>

phrases.phrase: Create New Custom Social Forum Field
Fields belonging to this group will disassociated, rather than deleted.
No custom social forum fields have been defined.
No custom thread fields have been defined.
On the next page, you may apply settings to all the selected fields. If you would like to base these settings on an existing field, select it here.
Options for the Custom Fields by Waindigo add-on.
Allow partial matches for textboxes and textareas in search
Enabling this option will allow users to search for part of the value of a custom field.
Only allow single selection in search for multiselect/checkboxes
If enabled, a select menu or radio buttons will be displayed in the search form instead of a multi-select menu or checkboxes, respectively, allowing for only a single value to be searched at once.
Show field titles when displaying custom fields (XenForo 1.2+ only)

Disabling this option will stop the field title from being included when custom fields are displayed. This will allow you to include your own modified/formatted field title as part of the Value Display HTML.
Always sort custom field choices alphabetically
Note: this may break the ability to search for existing values of multi-select and checkboxes fields if the content has not been updated and the order of the selected items has changed.
Only show fields in search if usable by user (XenForo 1.2+ only)

Enabling this option will only allow a user to see a field in a search form if a field is usable by all user groups or they are in a user group that is selected in the 'Usable by User Groups' option.
This option does not apply to User Fields which are always available to all user groups.
Edit thread fields by self (requires edit own post)
Please confirm that you want to delete the following field group
Please upload valid field XML file.
Position below title when creating a thread
The requested custom field attachment could not be found.
Required fields will always be shown during thread creation.

Use <font style="font-family: 'Courier New';">{$customFields.FIELD_ID}</font>, replacing <font style="font-family: 'Courier New';">FIELD_ID</font> with the required Field ID, to display custom field data in the header and footer.
No custom resource fields have been defined.
Show field in advanced thread and posts search
Show field in advanced user search
Show field in forum quick search

templates.template: {xen:phrase waindigo_custom_fields_customfields}

<xen:if is="{$search.customThreadFields}"> <xen:foreach loop="$search.customThreadFields" value="$threadFieldGroup"> <xen:foreach loop="$threadFieldGroup.fields" value="$field"> <xen:if is="{$field.field_type} == 'multiselect' AND {$xenOptions.waindigo_customFields_searchSingle}"> <xen:set var="{$field.field_type}">select</xen:set> </xen:if> <xen:if is="{$field.field_type} == 'checkbox' AND {$xenOptions.waindigo_customFields_searchSingle}"> <xen:set var="{$field.field_type}">radio</xen:set> </xen:if> <xen:if is="{$field.field_type} != 'callback'"> <xen:include template="custom_field_edit" /> </xen:if> </xen:foreach> </xen:foreach> </xen:if>

{$threadFieldGroup.title}

select radio
{$fieldGroup.title}
{$title}

{xen:phrase waindigo_edit_custom_fields_customfields}: {xen:helper threadPrefix, $thread, escaped}{$thread.title} {xen:phrase waindigo_edit_custom_fields_customfields}: {xen:helper threadPrefix, $thread}{$thread.title} {xen:helper threadPrefix, $thread}{$thread.title} {xen:helper nodeClasses, $nodeBreadCrumbs, $forum}

{$threadFieldGroup.title}

modification.description: Copyright notice for Custom Fields by Waindigo
Removes field title if required by options.
Adds custom fields from other groups.
Adds extra tabs to resource category.
Adds custom fields to resource filter menu.
Adds extra tabs to resource index.
Adds custom thread fields to the quick search.
Adds custom fields to Thread & Posts search form.
Adds custom fields to Resource search form.
Adds custom fields to Members search form.
